column1: Castilleja de la Cuesta is a town and municipality in the province of Seville
column2: in the autonomous community of Andalusia

column1: Hernán Cortés died in this town on December 2
column3: as his will directed that his remains be returned to Mexico.  They are interred in the Templo de Jesús
column4: which is part of the Hospital de Jesús Nazareno in Mexico City.

column1: This is the birthplace of actor and dancer Eduardo Cansino
column3: the father of Rita Hayworth. Footballer Miguel Ángel Llera

column1: Castilleja de la Cuesta has a local specialty
column2: the  "torta de aceite". This is a thin
column3: crisp baked good made with olive oil and having a hint of anise. They are eaten throughout Spain and exported to many countries.
